entity1.name: Rockets
entity1.description: A vehicle designed to travel through space or the atmosphere, often used for launching satellites or spacecraft.;;;A vehicle designed to travel through space or the atmosphere by expelling gas at high speed from a nozzle.;;;A small, typically non-functional replica of a larger rocket, often used for educational purposes or as a hobby.;;;A vehicle designed to travel through space or the atmosphere by ejecting a jet of gas at high speed in the opposite direction to the desired motion.;;;The main structure of a rocket, typically constructed from lightweight but durable materials.;;;A vehicle designed to travel through space or the atmosphere by ejecting a jet of fast-moving fluid or gas.;;;A vehicle designed to travel through space by expelling gas at high speed from a nozzle, often used in space exploration and satellite deployment.;;;A vehicle designed to travel through space or the atmosphere, often for scientific research or military purposes.;;;A vehicle designed to travel through space or the atmosphere, often used for launching satellites or carrying payloads.;;;A vehicle or device propelled by the ejection of gases produced by combustion, used for launching satellites and spacecraft into space.;;;A vehicle designed to travel through space or the atmosphere, often used for carrying payloads such as satellites or humans.
entity1.chunkid: How to Build a Rocket21;;;How to Build a Rocket4;;;How to Build a Rocket5;;;How to Build a Rocket10;;;How to Build a Rocket15;;;How to Build a Rocket7;;;How to Build a Rocket2;;;How to Build a Rocket8;;;How to Build a Rocket3;;;How to Build a Rocket14;;;How to Build a Rocket12;;;How to Build a Rocket6;;;How to Build a Rocket23;;;How to Build a Rocket24;;;How to Build a Rocket19;;;How to Build a Rocket18

entity2.name: space
entity2.description: The boundless three-dimensional extent in which objects and events have relative position and direction, particularly the area beyond Earth's atmosphere where celestial bodies exist.

entity4.name: initial design
entity4.description: The first stage in creating a rocket, involving conceptualization and planning of its structure and systems.

entity5.name: launch
entity5.description: The act of sending a rocket into the air or space, often as part of a scientific mission or hobbyist activity.;;;The act of sending a rocket into space or the atmosphere, marking the final phase of the rocket's development process.
entity5.chunkid: How to Build a Rocket22;;;How to Build a Rocket3

entity6.name: Step 1
entity6.description: The initial phase in a sequence of actions or steps.

entity7.name: Purpose and Requirements
entity7.description: Key aspects that define the goals and constraints of a project, such as a rocket build.;;;The intended use and necessary specifications that must be met by a project or product, in this case, the rocket.
entity7.chunkid: How to Build a Rocket7;;;How to Build a Rocket4

entity10.name: science project
entity10.description: An educational assignment or task that involves scientific research, experimentation, or the creation of a model to demonstrate a concept.

entity11.name: payload
entity11.description: The cargo or equipment carried by a rocket or spacecraft, intended for delivery into space or orbit.

entity12.name: orbit
entity12.description: A curved path around a celestial body, such as the Earth, where satellites and other objects can remain in motion due to gravitational forces.

entity17.name: propulsion system
entity17.description: An advanced method of spacecraft propulsion that uses electrical energy to accelerate propellant to high velocities, typically more efficient than chemical engines for long-duration missions.;;;A part of the rocket responsible for generating thrust to propel the vehicle.;;;The mechanism that generates thrust to move a rocket or spacecraft forward, typically consisting of engines and fuel systems.;;;The propulsion system is a critical component of the rocket, responsible for generating thrust to lift the rocket off the ground and propel it into space.;;;The mechanism that generates thrust to move a rocket or other vehicle forward.
entity17.chunkid: How to Build a Rocket15;;;How to Build a Rocket8;;;How to Build a Rocket14;;;How to Build a Rocket19

entity18.name: payload capacity
entity18.description: The maximum weight of cargo or equipment that a rocket can carry into space or the atmosphere.

entity20.name: materials and components
entity20.description: The physical items and parts required to construct a rocket, including but not limited to fuel, structural elements, and electronic systems.

entity21.name: metal
entity21.description: A lightweight and durable metal commonly used in the construction of rockets and other aerospace vehicles.;;;Materials made from two or more constituent materials with significantly different physical or chemical properties, one of which is a matrix and the other is a reinforcement.;;;A strong, lightweight composite material made from carbon fibers, often used in high-performance applications such as rocket construction.;;;A class of materials that are typically hard, dense, and conductive.
entity21.chunkid: How to Build a Rocket12;;;How to Build a Rocket11

entity23.name: fuel system
entity23.description: A component in vehicles that stores and delivers fuel to the engine for propulsion.

entity24.name: electronics
entity24.description: Devices or systems used for processing signals, data, and information, often used for guidance and control in various applications.;;;Electrical systems and devices used in the operation and control of the rocket.;;;Sophisticated devices used in modern rockets to control various functions and systems.;;;Computers that are integrated into the vehicle or machinery, often used for controlling and monitoring various functions.
entity24.chunkid: How to Build a Rocket16;;;How to Build a Rocket17;;;How to Build a Rocket19;;;How to Build a Rocket11

entity25.name: fins
entity25.description: Structural elements attached to the exterior of a vehicle or projectile to provide stability during flight.

entity26.name: nose cones
entity26.description: The forward-most part of a rocket, missile, or aircraft designed to reduce drag and protect the payload.

entity27.name: parachutes
entity27.description: Devices used to slow the motion of an object through an atmosphere by creating drag, typically deployed during descent to ensure a safe landing.

entity31.name: Fiberglass
entity31.description: A composite material made of glass fibers embedded in a resin matrix, known for its strength and lightweight properties, suitable for rocket body construction.

entity36.name: solid fuel engines
entity36.description: A type of engine used in rockets where the propellant is solid at room temperature, providing a simple and reliable propulsion method.

entity37.name: liquid fuel engines
entity37.description: A type of rocket engine that uses liquid propellants to generate thrust, offering more control over the combustion process compared to solid fuels.

entity38.name: hybrid engines
entity38.description: A propulsion system for rockets that combines elements of both solid and liquid fuel engines, potentially offering a balance between simplicity and performance.

entity41.name: Guidance Systems
entity41.description: Advanced systems designed to direct the rocket's flight path, ensuring accuracy and safety during launch.

entity42.name: sensors
entity42.description: Devices that detect and respond to some type of input from the physical environment.

entity43.name: actuators
entity43.description: Mechanical or electro-mechanical devices used to move or control a mechanism or system.

entity45.name: design plans
entity45.description: Detailed drawings or specifications that outline how a system should be constructed or assembled.

entity46.name: Step 7
entity46.description: A specific step in a procedure or process, indicating the stage of testing and launching.

entity52.name: science and engineering principles
entity52.description: Fundamental theories and practices from scientific and technical disciplines that are essential for designing and building complex systems like rockets.

entity53.name: rocket-building journey
entity53.description: A process or project of constructing a rocket, typically involving design, assembly, and testing phases.

entity55.name: the great unknown
entity55.description: A metaphorical term referring to unexplored territories or the vastness of outer space, symbolizing adventure and discovery.

entity56.name: student
entity56.description: A person who is enrolled in a school or educational institution and is learning various subjects.

entity57.name: hobbyist
entity57.description: An amateur enthusiast of a particular activity, often pursued for pleasure rather than profit.

entity58.name: aerospace engineer
entity58.description: A professional who designs and builds aircraft, spacecraft, satellites, and missiles.

entity60.name: safety
entity60.description: The condition of being protected from or unlikely to cause danger, risk, or injury.

entity61.name: regulations
entity61.description: Official rules and guidelines set by authorities that must be followed.

entity62.name: guidelines
entity62.description: Suggested procedures or principles to follow, often less strict than regulations.
